Reviews.Title: “Good value within driving distance of Montserrat and barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Serigirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights. The hotel was really empty when we stayed. It is a large hotel and we only saw about three other guests during our stay. The receptionist was very helpful. Rooms were large and clean. Hotel was well cared for but slightly outdated. It is located near a golf course and has lovely peaceful views. Nearest town with grocery and other services was about a 15 minute drive away so a car is a must. The few other guests were all American contract workers who were staying several weeks. Its not really a good destination hotel as it feels sort of isolated and but it is a great stopping point to stay near Barcelona and Montserrat. Free parking and wifi were included.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and mondern, good if u have a car”
Reviews.Author: shampoo999
Reviews.Content: This is the final stop of our drive-thru trip in Spain, having traveled from Madrid, Toledo, Jaen, Valencia and stayed in 4 Paradores before staying here. This hotel is clean and modern, good for it's price, but with no room service other than the minimal cleaning ( ie. we asked for cutlery to eat fruits, and we had to get it ourselves from the bar near the lobby.. a bit of a walk indeed). It's 28km from city centre and to the airport, so you would really need a car. Car park is free but there is a persistent puddle in the car park which we had to jump across everynight after returning which is a nuisance. Gym was a bit small, pool was slightly dirty, and it would be nice to have a balcony too. The receptionist was very friendly and helpful though.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing & Comfortable in great surroundings”
Reviews.Author: JeffBHongKong
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in July 2010 and really enjoyed it. If you don't mind driving 20-25 mn to Barcelona downtown, this is THE place. Even if you don't play golf, you will enjoy walking around the park. The small village a few KM away from the hotel has a nice atmosphere where you can enjoy a simple and inexpensive dinner outside. Rooms are clean, good size, well equipped bathrooms with jet showers and bathtubs. Swimming pool is supposed to close at 9:00 pm but nobody will say anything if you stay longer. Food is good. Staff is nice even and you can wear very casual even though this golf resort is used to seeing jet set members. A great place to relax after a busy day in Barcelona. YES ! we will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: aningeniousname
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in this for two nights and I have nothing but praise for the hotel and their wonderful staff. From the clean modern rooms to the wonderful pool area the whole experience was a delight. The breakfast buffet catered to all tastes and was a highlight of our stay. I must mention the excellent staff at the Barcelo. We had a problem with a rental car and the staff dealt with it for us,making endless phone calls to the car company on our behalf, while we sat round the pool. Definitely worth a visit but be warned it is a long way outside Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great views, modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelman050
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel on the way back from Murcia to the UK; great location for views and the actual mountain range (Montserrat.) Rooms are execllent, clean, modern, everything worked! The hotel is modern and pleasant. The staff were ok when speaking Spanish but were not that pleased to speak in English (which is fair enough!) The swimming pool was small for the size of hotel but very safe. Great little pool for under 2's or non swimmers. Drinks expensive but it is near Barcelona. The food was ok nothing special. Never had a time to play golf but it looked fantastic. Ideal hotel for couples with very young children. Nice Spa too! A long weekend type hotel & way too far out of Barcelona to drive in & cabs, will cost you an earth especially on the return journey. That said the room cost €93.00 for the three of us so good value.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: GuillermoN
Reviews.Content: In Montserrat, this hotel features a 18 hole par 5 golf course, amazing rooms, and great service. if you are going to barcelona, this spot is worth a stay.

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: socks3
Reviews.Content: I have spent 4 great long week-ends at this hotel in the last 6 months and enjoyed all of them. I have always found the staff courteous,polite and helpful. Yes, the service can be a little slower than you are used to in the U.K. but it's a holiday so relax and enjoy! As for not having enough sun loungers isn't that the normal thing where ever you are! I will certainly come here again and would recommend it to any new visitors. Come and see for yourself, you will not be disappointed. If there happens to be a wedding while you are there it can only add to your experience of life in Spain. I came to relax and unwind which I did!

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful spot, but staff have attitude problem”
Reviews.Author: Ninty2
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five days at this hotel in late August. I'd played golf at the adjacent course the previous year, and thought the hotel looked fabulous. It's a quiet, peaceful place - when there isn't a wedding being held there! - but it could be so much better. The bar and restaurant service is painfully slow, and the staff can be abrupt and outright rude. The food is generally OK when it eventually arrives, but don't expect gourmet Catelonian food. If you want that, head for the Can Bonastre wine resort 5 km north, which is an oasis in comparison, but also much more expensive. Unless the Barcelo management sort out the staffing problem, and unless you're luckier than we were, this is a place to avoid. Also, the spa costs hotel guests 13 euros, which is a disgrace. The pool is good, but lacks adequate sunloungers.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel but!!....”
Reviews.Author: mijulie56
Reviews.Content: Julie & Edna. Bolton Lancs....My mother & I visited this hotel knowing that it was located outside Barcelona & with a view to travelling 'in', but we didnt realise how far 'out' it was , & how expensive the taxis would be,(our taxi driver got completely lost!! consequently a dearer ride!). The hotel itself is very nice & the rooms are very clean & spacious, but spending seven days there is definately NOT recommended. The hotel seems to cater for conferences & business people rather than the holiday maker, unless of course you play golf, then that is a different matter as the hotel is surrounded by a magnificant golf course!... We did find a fantastic local restaurant just on the main road from the hotel, it can't be missed as it's THE ONLY ONE! It is fantastic for a typicall catalonian meal & is family run, with very freindly staff, despite the language barriers..... because of the isolation.. we would not visit this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great - But don't consider it without a car”
Reviews.Author: pinnertraveller1986
Reviews.Content: Booked the Barcelo Montserrat Hotel through Superbreak.com for £256 for a four night stay in a double room with breakfast. The first thing to say is that you have to have a car to stay here. If you don't then don't consider it - the nearest town is Martorell - which is quite industrial and about a 10-15 minute taxi ride away, costing €15-20, with the train to Barcelona costing just under €5 return. There are not really any restaurants that we found nearby, and the nearest town - Sant Esteves which was very sleepy - has little amenities and is about an hours walk away. Thats the bad part - now for the good part - (as long as you have a car!) Parking in Barcelona is unbelievably expensive - expect to pay €30 for over 12 hours parking anywhere near the city. However we did find two gems - one in particular. The first is that there is a limited amount of free parking spaces towards Parc Guell, but there are normally full, and they are still around 15 minutes walk to the nearest metro. The best parking is in the City Centre by Glories Roundabout with its own metro station 2 stops from Pl de Catalunya. It normally costs €31.20 for over 12 hours, but if you go in and park, take your ticket to the booth and ask to buy a "Metropark" ticket, then you can get up to 18 hours parking for €5.50 INCLUDING unlimited metro, tram and bus travel. This is unrivaled and we found it to be excellent. We also found a fantastic place to eat in the harbour on the main pier, at the rear of the aquarium, where we had 1 bottle of cava, 2 bottles of wine, 5 tapas, 2 bottles of water, bread, 4 mains, 1 dessert, and 7 liquers for £25 each with a harbour view and tables outside. It is decked out in black leather seats and looks very fancy, with a set of tables located at the front with blue and orange lights. The hotel itself is great, with underground parking, great pool, nice rooms - no doubles, just two singles pushed together, made up seperatley, nice reasonable bar and restaurant, as well as indoor pool, ping pong and pool. The bathrooms have no doors, just a glass one to the toilet and shower. The Restaurant lacks atmosphere but the food was great, as were the breakfasts. We also drove to Sitges for the day (40 miles and €10 return in the toll road or free on the costal road) which was beautiful. The beaches and sea were great as is the entire coastline south of Barcelona. The Friexnet Cava factory is highly recommended, and you can get a tour of their huge factory and a glass of Cava for €4 each, although we were not charged for some reason!! The hotel is located 10 minuted drive from the E-90 Motorway, which is just past a toll booth from and to Barcelona, and in any direction on the motorway - this costs €1.85 for a regular car. In terms of a supermarket there is a large Carrefour in Martorell by the station. Overall the hotel is really good - clean, friendly, reasonable bar and restaurant, lovely pool, large rooms, and great rooms - most having a great view of the Montserrat Monestry. A great option for exploring the region - but if you are only going for Barcelona, then stay in the City, and also stay in Sitges if you want a beach! 8/10 for this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: cphyde
Reviews.Content: This is a very up-market hotel with good sized rooms with quality fittings and tiled floors. Excellent restaurant - huge breakfast buffet for 12 Euros and brilliant 4-course dinner menu for 25 Euros. Stunning views over golf course and surrounding hilly countryside. It was very quiet in all senses. Mostly French and Spanish guests, some English. Pool and lawn area very good for sunbathing and keeping our 9 year old happy. Table tennis, pool and bar-footie available. All in all, a very good hotel. The one issue you might have is that the waiters do not speak much English. Reception have good English, but the waiters very little. Sometimes, service was slow. The waiters seem a bit amateurish, but in our experience not a problem. You need a car: it is about 20 km outside Barcelona and off the beaten track. Not a tourist area and you will struggle to find many that speak English in the local area. We ate in the hotel partly because nowhere else was open. Barcelona can easily be reached by car. We were advised to park in the University (closed for the summer) and take the Metro. It took about 20-30 minutes by car. Metro was very efficient. But keep hold of your purses: we had money stolen on the Metro. Incidentally, you have a great view of the mountain of Montserrat and the monastery at the top is worth a visit (on a clear day). The signs lead you all the way up by road around the west side, but if you go the other way and head up the C-55 to the village of Monistrol de Montserrat, you will find a cable-car and a railway to take you up.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - but need a car”
Reviews.Author: bryansSheffield
Reviews.Content: Originally we were looking for a hotel in Barcelona but a world congress had block booked most of the hotel rooms. This problem meant we had to look outside the city for accommodation - but this turned into an advantage when we spotted this hotel. We booked the hotel at a total cost of £400 for 4 nights - 2 children - 2 adults - 2 rooms. We hired a car from the airport. The hotel was excellent in every way, the view from the hotel window comprised of a golf course and the Montserrat mountains (stunning). Staff were friendly, eager to please and most spoke english. Barcelona was very simple to get to. 10 minutes in car to Martorell station and train to Sants metro station (train runs approx every 10 mins). Automated (english language) ticket machines at martorell station can be used to buy block tickets that can be used on train/metro/funiculars are simple to use. Glad we hired a car because it meant we were able to visit Montserrat monastary (a must) and Sitges

Reviews.Title: “Nice .....but!”
Reviews.Author: Cruiserjools
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights in July, after picking up a great deal on the internet (also 5 nights for price of 4). We knew the hotel was out of the way, and were quite happy with that. We hired a car and were able to see something different in the region every day (Barcelona, the mountains, the wineries, the coast etc etc). However, although the hotel, the accommodation and the location were all stunning, there was definitely something lacking (atmosphere?). For what should have been a very busy time of year, it appeared almost empty, and if it hadn't have been for a couple of functions happening during our time there, we would have seen very few people! Service in the bar and restaurant areas was very poor- language (and lack of enthusiasm) was a constant problem - , and the night we ate in the buffet restaurant, there were only 2 other tables occupied. The food, although very good, looked as though it had been set out some time before, and obviously since there were very few customers, it hadn't been refreshed. The bar at the pool was never open, which meant if you wanted a drink you had to climb the stairs to the bar and hope someone could be bothered to serve you. The pool area was lovely and always quiet - no chair hoggers here! Contrary to that, however, was the service we received from the reception and maintenance staff. We had a couple of small "niggles" which needed attention in our room (safe locked when we got there, shower not working) and each of these was attended to immediately. We were very impressed. I don't know if we would stay here again. The lack of other places around to eat out is a big down point (although try the restaurant at the top of the road - it is obviously a favourite with locals, and when we ate there for lunch one day, we got 3 courses with bread, bottled water and coffee for 8 euros each! Nothing fancy, no menu apart from what the waitresses had written on their pads, but a fantastic experience. )

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Gingawarrior
Reviews.Content: Our holiday here was spoiled by the fact that despite how this hotel is advertised it is totally inaccessable by public transport. We did not have a car but booked for 4 nights thinking we could use the local train station to explore Barcelona and surrouding areas = THIS IS NOT THE CASE. Taxis cost up to 20 Euro to the nearest train station so it would have been much better if the hotel had available a courtesy bus or taxi service. One evening we had a couple of drinks in the local town of Sant Esteve Sesovries and had to rely on the police station to find us a taxi back to this hotel. This was only 10pm. On trying to discuss this with the manager we found him to be very defensive and unhelpful = not willing to accept any responsibility . We would never stay here again or recommend that independant travellers without their own transport stay here either. In fact we booked elsewhere for our 4th night thereby cutting short our stay as we could not get around.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome time with my friends!”
Reviews.Author: MrMadison
Reviews.Content: I was with my friends in Barcelona, and we really wanted a hotel with a view, golf wasnt that important. But good food and hot people. And seriously at first we doubted it- But the girls at this hotel, and the girls that work @ this hotel are amazing!- We found the accomodations perfect, the food is great Great buffet, im a fan of luxury foods, and the food is very good.. Hotel's decor is nice, big. somewhere to hang out in the middle of the night if your like us.. Lots of young people. Were from miami florida.. and we felt pretty satisfied here.. A++

Reviews.Title: “Great, Clean and very comfortable in a fabulous setting.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights before taking a cruise from Barcelona. Please note this hotel is quite difficult to find and is secluded area-EXACTLY what we wanted but not for everyone. Rooms are first class with great contemporary decor and huge bathroom/dressing areas. Pool area was great too and always quiet. Golf available (except mondays) though expensive at 100 euros a round. Food on buffet nights was first class...great quality with huge choice (I have eaten in fine restaurants around the world and fail to imagine why anyone would be disappointed with the dinner buffet in this hotel....and its only 21 euros inc wine !!!) Loved breakfasts too with great choice. Disappointed though with table d'hote dinner on two nights (No real problems with food though portions could have been better) as service was dreadfully slow...lack of staff and at one point one rather large and surly waitress was serving 10 tables on her own. Besides this we always had crisps and nuts with drinks (maybe the last reviewers complaints about this have paid off fo us ?) and found the lunchtime snacks menu good with choice of sandwiches, burgers etc. Will definitely stay here again but will dine locally (in Capellades or Martorell) a few nights too,

Reviews.Title: “Quite far, but quite nice”
Reviews.Author: toutoute
Reviews.Content: It is far, but it should be a shame not to try it. A good 30 mn to Barcelona city center, with a fair amount of motorway to get there. But once there, you'll like it. Huge room, huger bathroom still, very contemporary decor and fabrics, balcony with a lovely view of the Monteserrat mountains. The outside pool was lovely - but chilly, the inside pool was lovely - but not of free access, which is perhaps a little mean in a 5 stars property. Huge breakfast buffet, yet again in a splendid decor. Very helpful staff. A lovely retreat after a few days in the city center.

HotelInfo.Name: Barcelo Montserrat
HotelInfo.Address: Ctra Matorell Capellades, Km 19.5 | Sant Esteve de Sesrovires, 08635 Barcelona, Spain
